rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d1428f6.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d1428f6.1503</link>   <description> And here's the two page summary version that just lists the five things you need<br>to do, which you can give to colleagues who /don't/ understand wireless and why things<br>need to be done in certain ways for the best results.<br><br>http://www.cisco.com/web/strategy/docs/education/092111HDWifi.pdf<br><br>Regards,<br>Paul<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Foster, Jon<br>Sent: Wednesday, March 11, 2015 1:23 PM<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Wifi survey tools [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:55:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Hill (phill)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d1428f6.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;b19e8209.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;b19e8209.1503</link>   <description> For getting wall attenuation, you need to measure 3-5m of free space loss, then the exact same distance with free space and the wall in question. It is the difference between the two. Do a couple and average. You have to get away from near field and first Fresnel zone issues. Check w/ just free-space then w/ walls at same distance as the free-space data point. Be sure to do multiples though, one might be anomaly, like right at a metal stud. You do not need to use exact ap you will be installing or power level. This is all [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T13:48:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Trent Hurt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;b19e8209.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3dadd4f9.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3dadd4f9.1503</link>   <description> I'm not generally a fan of Vendor guides, but just flicking through that cisco guide - definitely some good reading in there! And pretty vendor agnostic.<br><br>Jon.<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Scott Armitage<br>Sent: 11 March 2015 12:28<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Wifi survey tools<br><br>&gt; On 11 Mar 2015, at 12:13, Alan Buxey &lt;A.L.M.Buxey@lboro.ac.uk&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; hi,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; one of the key things is the PURPOSE of the wireless. theres one thign<br>&gt; saying a building is going to have total wireless coverage...and a<br>> whol eanother ball [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T13:23:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Foster, Jon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3dadd4f9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;e430f25e.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;e430f25e.1503</link>   <description> &gt; On 11 Mar 2015, at 12:13, Alan Buxey &lt;A.L.M.Buxey@lboro.ac.uk&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; hi,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; one of the key things is the PURPOSE of the wireless. theres one thign saying a building<br>&gt; is going to have total wireless coverage...and a whol eanother ball game when you find<br>&gt; that parts of the building are store rooms with 2 wireless stock trackers , another<br>&gt; part is a teaching lab with 150 tablets all doing live coursework, a lecture theatre<br>&gt; with 200 capacity with video-to-seat learning modules etc. IF the project knows all this<br>> stuff when they [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T12:28:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Scott Armitage</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;e430f25e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;2c042bcc.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;2c042bcc.1503</link>   <description> hi,<br><br>one of the key things is the PURPOSE of the wireless. theres one thign saying a building<br>is going to have total wireless coverage...and a whol eanother ball game when you find<br>that parts of the building are store rooms with 2 wireless stock trackers , another<br>part is a teaching lab with 150 tablets all doing live coursework, a lecture theatre<br>with 200 capacity with video-to-seat learning modules etc. IF the project knows all this<br>stuff when they are still doing just the shell of the building and the occupants<br>and usaes havent actually been planned/finalised then thats [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T12:13:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alan Buxey</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;2c042bcc.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;ef1851ab.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;ef1851ab.1503</link>   <description> We're in the process of changing how we handle this. Up to now our GPR has<br>stated that we require a 10mx10m grid of APs as a &quot;best effort&quot;. Obviously<br>this is suboptimal for almost every building and doesn't really take the<br>plans into account at all.<br><br>There are several theoretical approaches in decreasing order of resultant<br>wifi quality: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T11:20:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Elliott</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;ef1851ab.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;c6b2eaca.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;c6b2eaca.1503</link>   <description> Hi,<br><br>I can vouch for using Ekahau. We bought it last summer and it is very good. I would recommend you use the demo and sit in with one of their webinar sessions demonstrating the application before making a decision. Open Reality organised this for me.<br><br>As for getting attenuation reading from walls a quick way I have done in the past is use a android smartphone in hotspot mode and measure the signal with a Aircheck fluke or any Wi-Fi scanner software available. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T10:59:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pranay Pancholi</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;c6b2eaca.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;9b1537e5.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;9b1537e5.1503</link>   <description> Hi all,<br><br>How to design a WLAN in a yet-to-be-built building - I reckon there is scope for a whole UCISA document on this topic alone!<br><br>I've yet to work on a building project which has gone to plan, or where data points have all been installed correctly, in the right places - whether or not the WLAN has been highly designed or not. Sometimes it feels like I might as well just go through with a floorplan, put a big red circle on it and say &quot;wi-fi somewhere here please&quot;. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T10:40:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Foster, Jon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;9b1537e5.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;baa7c52f.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;baa7c52f.1503</link>   <description> +1 :)<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Matthew Newton<br>Sent: 15 December 2014 16:58<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Wifi survey tools<br><br>On Mon, Dec 15, 2014 at 04:51:03PM +0000, Alan Buxey wrote:<br>&gt; anyone want/up for a wireless BoF at Networkshop? :-)<br><br>Do you really need to ask the question? :) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T10:19:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Foster, Jon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;baa7c52f.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;b1a0c6f7.1503">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;b1a0c6f7.1503</link>   <description> Hi David,<br><br>Ekahau is, IMO awesome compared to Airmagnet, and worth every penny.<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd They are very engaged with the community (via twitter at least) with regards to developing the product- with CAD import in the new version 8 beta.<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd They seem willing to acknowledge the limitations of the product and ask \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdok, what is it you actually want?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T10:12:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Foster, Jon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;b1a0c6f7.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;731b9a06.1503">   <title>Re: Aruba Clearpass - VM Specs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;731b9a06.1503</link>   <description> Hi Daniel,<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm keen to know this also! I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve been advised separately by a bunch of engineers that Aruba are unlikely to shift on the requirements. If you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre doing very little with the box, my guess is it would cope fine \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd BUT since you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdd lose TAC support from Aruba (I imagine), you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve little choice but to run with the recommended Spe\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd unless you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve got in house ClearPass Wizards. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T09:59:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Foster, Jon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;731b9a06.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;357cc27d.1503">   <title>Re: HP to aquire Aruba </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;357cc27d.1503</link>   <description> I'm cautiously optimistic about this - Hopefully HP have learnt from their own and others mistakes - you can't acquire a Wi-Fi vendor and sit still!<br><br>I imagine the CEO / CTO would have had to agree to hold their stock for at least a year following the acquisition, so their immediate departure would be unlikely I think... Let's see where we are in 12 months! [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T09:56:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Foster, Jon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;357cc27d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d4ad50d4.1503">   <title>Interference from other wifi devices </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d4ad50d4.1503</link>   <description> Guys,<br><br>How do you handle interference from other wifi devices within your<br>institution.<br>EG AMX video conferencing devices<br><br>Bill Byers<br>University of Edinburgh Network Team    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T09:05:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bill Byers</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d4ad50d4.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;8d027e7.1503">   <title>Re: HP to aquire Aruba </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;8d027e7.1503</link>   <description> It's a good sign that Arubas CEO and CTO will be leading the new combined organisation...<br><br>Garry - and look what happened there :/ stagnation's the word I would use. There 802.11AC equipment is Aruba<br><br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Pollard, Matt<br>Sent: 02 March 2015 14:54<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: HP to aquire Aruba [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T15:05:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Jackson (IT Services)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;8d027e7.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7c0cb04c.1503">   <title>Re: HP to aquire Aruba </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7c0cb04c.1503</link>   <description> We've only just installed Aruba so I'm hoping they leave them fairly independent. I can see why they would want a decent WiFi solution in their portfolio though.<br><br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Wardrope, Garry J.<br>Sent: 02 March 2015 14:51<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: HP to aquire Aruba [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:54:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pollard, Matt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7c0cb04c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3d59d591.1503">   <title>Re: HP to aquire Aruba </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3d59d591.1503</link>   <description> We thought it was a good thing when Juniper bought 'Trapeze' !<br><br>Garry Wardrope<br>IT Security and Infrastructure Development Manager<br>University of Aberdeen<br>Directorate of Information Technology<br>Edward Wright Building<br>Dunbar Street<br>Aberdeen, AB24 3QY<br>+44 (0) 1224 273337<br><br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Tomo<br>Sent: 02 March 2015 14:26<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: HP to aquire Aruba [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:51:02+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Wardrope, Garry J.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3d59d591.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7ed998b8.1503">   <title>HP to aquire Aruba </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7ed998b8.1503</link>   <description> There was a fair bit of speculation in the press last week about HP buying Aruba.<br>It's now confirmed.<br><br>http://www.arubanetworks.com/aruba-and-hp/?source=homepage<br><br>If HP can keep Aruba a little arms length and let them continue to innovate whilst allowing some integration with their switching portfolio it might be a good thing. But there's always risks, and the devil is always in the detail.    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:26:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tomo</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7ed998b8.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;75792445.1502">   <title>Re: Chromecast Screen Mirroring </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;75792445.1502</link>   <description> Hello Paul<br>Thanks for taking the time to get back to me. I had seen the first document and had worked through it. Think that may have been written before the &quot;mirroring&quot; was available on the Chromecast.<br>I'd not see the second so I will give that a go.<br>Regards<br>Jan<br><br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Paul Hill (phill)<br>Sent: 16 February 2015 3:26 PM<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Chromecast Screen Mirroring [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T09:13:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jan Dent</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;75792445.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;4ed7954a.1502">   <title>Re: Chromecast Screen Mirroring </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;4ed7954a.1502</link>   <description> Hi Jan,<br><br>Possibly this config guide to get the best out of Chromecast may help:<br>http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/7-6/chromecastDG76/ChromecastDG76.html<br><br>or this tip:<br>http://www.md3v.com/cisco-wireless-access-points-and-the-google-chromecast<br><br>Regards,<br>Paul<br><br>From: Wireless Issues in the JANET community [mailto:WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Jan Dent<br>Sent: Monday, February 16, 2015 9:43 AM<br>To: WIRELESS-ADMIN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Chromecast Screen Mirroring<br><br>Hello<br><br>I'm seeking help getting Chromcast Screen casting working on our Wi-Fi running on a Cisco 5508 WLC. I have upgraded it to the latest code [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T15:26:01+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Hill (phill)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;4ed7954a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3cad05d3.1502">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3cad05d3.1502</link>   <description> Well, the two quotes from Openreality and Lever are the same to the pound so I don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt think either of them love us a lot. By double the cost I mean that ESS Pro is double the price of ESS Standard. We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre currently installing wireless at one of our older sites with all the inherent difficulties that brings, the planning (and monitoring ) within Aerohive seems good but it is slightly a case of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdnot knowing what we\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre missing\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd compared to ESS and the like hence the question. However, we\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre also not likely to be doing as much planning and [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T15:18:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Sullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;3cad05d3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;dc90cb4e.1502">   <title>Chromecast Screen Mirroring </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;dc90cb4e.1502</link>   <description> Hello<br><br>I'm seeking help getting Chromcast Screen casting working on our Wi-Fi running on a Cisco 5508 WLC. I have upgraded it to the latest code<br><br>Chromcasting works fine but I just can't get the screen casting to work, the tablets can't find the Chromecast device. As a temporary work around I installed a couple of TP-Link router come APs plugged into the wired network and they work fine (but also introduce other issues) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T09:43:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jan Dent</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;dc90cb4e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7a85b86.1502">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7a85b86.1502</link>   <description> Echoing the previous post\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>We use Ekahau and I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm happy with the planning tools. I have not really used many other planning tools other than the ones built into Cisco Prime.<br><br>The number of access points and antennas available to select from is extensive and grows with each release. The ability to do channel planning and simulation in 3D is also one its strengths. You can add multiple floors, line them up with each other and also add floor voids or exclusion areas where they exist. The materials available to select from when drawing in the walls are customisable. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T17:32:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stobbs, Darren</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;7a85b86.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d285ad54.1502">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d285ad54.1502</link>   <description> We moved from airmagnet to ekahau last year Worth double the cost? Depends what you do and how you use it (also the price you pay will also depend on supplier and your relationship with them)   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T17:28:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alan Buxey</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;d285ad54.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;161bb0e0.1502">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;161bb0e0.1502</link>   <description> I vote yes,<br><br>For one I will never fully trust any wlan vendor predictive planning tool. It can give you good idea but I would rather have something vendor agnostic for determining ap counts. Some other stuff I really like on Ekahau are<br><br>Anyway I really like a few things with ekahau. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T17:14:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Trent Hurt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;161bb0e0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;c6ec409b.1502">   <title>Re: Wifi survey tools </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;c6ec409b.1502</link>   <description> Reviving this thread once more \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre having a look at purchasing Ekahau Site Survey at the moment for surveying. We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre currently using the Aerohive planning tool for planning and are wondering if the planning parts of ESS over and above what we can currently do with the Aerohive planning software are worth double the cost. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T16:53:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Sullivan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=wireless-admin;c6ec409b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
